Class Vector

  • java.lang.Object
    • Vector

  • public class Vector
extends java.lang.Object
    This class represents a mathematical vector as a direction and magnitude. Note, this class has no relation to java.util.Vector!
    Author:
    Robert C. Duvall

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Vector()
      Create a zero vector, i.e., with no magnitude.
      Vector(double angle, double magnitude)
      Create a vector in the given direction with the given magnitude.
      Vector(Point2d source, Point2d target)
      Constructor using javax.vecmath.Point2d
      Vector(java.awt.geom.Point2D source, java.awt.geom.Point2D target)
      Create a vector whose direction and magnitude are determined by direction and distance between the two given points.
      Vector(Vector other)
      Create a vector that is identical to the given other vector.

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description

      Returns the average of this vector with the given other vector.

      Subtracts the given vector from this vector.

      Returns the distance represented by the given dx and dy

      Returns the distance between given two points
      double dotProduct(Vector other) 
      boolean equals(java.lang.Object vector)
      Return true if this vector has the same magnitude and direction as the given other vector.
      static boolean fuzzyEquals(double a, double b)
      Returns true if two real values are approximately equal.
      double getAngleBetween(Vector other)
      Returns the angle between this vector and the given other vector.
      double getDirection()
      Returns this vector's direction (in degrees).
      double getMagnitude()
      Returns this vector's magnitude (in pixels).
      double getRelativeMagnitude(Vector other)
      Returns this vector's magnitude relative to the given other vector.
      double getXChange()
      Returns the change in only the X direction represented by this vector.
      double getYChange()
      Returns the change in only the Y direction represented by this vector.
      void negate()
      Returns a vector of the same magnitude, but in the opposite direction as this vector.
      void reset()
      Reset this vector to zero.

      Scales this vector's magnitude by the given change value.

      Adds the given vector to this vector.

      Returns this vector's values formatted as a string.

      Adjusts this vector's direction by the given change value.

    • Method Detail

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Reset this vector to zero.

      • getMagnitude

        public double getMagnitude()
        Returns this vector's magnitude (in pixels).

      • getRelativeMagnitude

        public double getRelativeMagnitude(Vector other)
        Returns this vector's magnitude relative to the given other vector. More formally, returns the magnitude of this vector projected onto the given other vector.

      • dotProduct

        public double dotProduct(Vector other)

      • scale

        public void scale(double change)
        Scales this vector's magnitude by the given change value.
        • A value of 1 leaves the magnitude unchanged
        • Values less than 1 reduce the magnitude
        • Values greater than 1 increase the magnitude

      • getDirection

        public double getDirection()
        Returns this vector's direction (in degrees).

      • getAngleBetween

        public double getAngleBetween(Vector other)
        Returns the angle between this vector and the given other vector.

      • turn

        public void turn(double change)
        Adjusts this vector's direction by the given change value.

      • getXChange

        public double getXChange()
        Returns the change in only the X direction represented by this vector.

      • getYChange

        public double getYChange()
        Returns the change in only the Y direction represented by this vector.

      • sum

        public void sum(Vector other)
        Adds the given vector to this vector.

      • difference

        public void difference(Vector other)
        Subtracts the given vector from this vector.

      • negate

        public void negate()
        Returns a vector of the same magnitude, but in the opposite direction as this vector.

        public Vector average(Vector other)
        Returns the average of this vector with the given other vector.

        public static boolean fuzzyEquals(double a,
                                  double b)
        Returns true if two real values are approximately equal. For more details, see http://www.ibm.com/developerworks/java/library/j-jtp0114/#N10255 This function exists in many add-on libraries, but not standard Java :(
